claim: The broken drain piece with a marker line was identified along the anterolateral aspect of the left knee radiograph in anteroposterior view (Figure 1) and a lateral view (Figure 2).
title: Figure 1. Post-operative radiograph of bilateral knees (anteroposterior view) .
caption: Post-operative radiograph of bilateral knees in anteroposterior view with a broken drain in left knee marked with white arrows.

claim: The broken drain piece with a marker line was identified along the anterolateral aspect of the left knee radiograph in anteroposterior view (Figure 1) and a lateral view (Figure 2).
title: Figure 2. Post-operative radiograph of the left knee (lateral view).
caption: Post-operative radiograph of the left knee in lateral view delineating the broken drain piece with multiple black arrows.

claim: However, the studies that have found no significant difference in outcomes have been underpowered (Figure 5).
title: Figure 5. Screenshot of OpenAI ChatGPT response to “Are drains useful in knee arthroplasty surgery?”.

claim: The American Association of Hip and Knee surgeon’s (AAHKS) has guidelines and recommendations on the use of drain in TKA (Figure 6).
title: Figure 6. Screenshot of OpenAI ChatGPT response to “Are there any recommendations by American association society of knee surgeons?”.

claim: Another study on 889 TKA reported a broken drain in two patients (0.2%) (Figure 7).
title: Figure 7. Screenshot of OpenAI ChatGPT response to “The incidence of drain breakage during knee arthroplasty?” .

claim: The drain can be secured in TKA with suture, staple, drain holder, adhesive strip, and tissue adhesive with emphasis on reducing the infection (Figure 8).
title: Figure 8. Screenshot of OpenAI ChatGPT response to “How to secure a drain in knee arthroplasty?”.

claim: The drain requires monitoring and timely removal to minimize the complications [2] (Figure 9).
title: Figure 9. Screenshot of OpenAI ChatGPT response to “Drain technique in elective total joint arthroplasty by Sami Jaafar - is it an interesting read?”.

claim: A prompt removal of drain is preferred based on the specific case and the patient overall health status (Figure 10).
title: Figure 10. Screenshot of OpenAI ChatGPT response to “How to handle a broken drain in an operated patient?” .

claim:
We acknowledge the neutral opinion of OpenAI ChatGPT and have incorporated its suggestions in the final manuscript with relevant references.Appendices
